nodes.label: Early Evolution of Photosynthesis Study
nodes.description: Academic research investigating the early evolutionary history of photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Chlorobium tepidum
nodes.description: A green sulfur bacterium, one of the two organisms from which new gene sequences were analyzed.

nodes.label: Chloroflexus aurantiacus
nodes.description: A green nonsulfur bacterium, one of the two organisms from which new gene sequences were analyzed.

nodes.label: Heliobacteria
nodes.description: A group of photosynthetic bacteria found to be closest to the last common ancestor of all oxygenic photosynthetic lineages.

nodes.label: Purple Bacteria
nodes.description: A group of photosynthetic bacteria identified as the earliest emerging phototrophic lineage by this study.

nodes.label: Oxygenic Photosynthetic Lineages
nodes.description: Evolutionary groups of organisms that perform oxygen-producing photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Gene Sequence Analysis
nodes.description: Experimental method involving the analysis of new gene sequences to infer evolutionary relationships and pathways.

nodes.label: Phylogenetic Analyses (Methods)
nodes.description: Computational methods (e.g., various algorithms) used to infer evolutionary relationships between organisms or genes.

nodes.label: ~100 kb Genomic Sequence
nodes.description: Approximately 100 kilobases of genomic DNA sequence analyzed from *Chlorobium tepidum* and *Chloroflexus aurantiacus*.

nodes.label: 31 Photosynthesis-Related ORFs
nodes.description: Thirty-one open reading frames (ORFs) identified within the analyzed genomic sequences, related to photosynthetic pathways.

nodes.label: Bacteriochlorophyll Biosynthesis
nodes.description: The biochemical pathway for producing bacteriochlorophyll, a light-harvesting pigment in anoxygenic photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Porphyrin Biosynthesis
nodes.description: The biochemical pathway for synthesizing porphyrins, which are precursors to chlorophylls and bacteriochlorophylls.

nodes.label: Carotenoid Biosynthesis
nodes.description: The biochemical pathway for producing carotenoids, accessory pigments involved in light harvesting and photoprotection.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Electron Transfer
nodes.description: The process by which electrons are moved through a series of carriers to generate energy in photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Chlorophyll Biosynthesis
nodes.description: The biochemical pathway for producing chlorophyll, the primary light-harvesting pigment in oxygenic photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Common Ancestor of Oxygenic Lineages
nodes.description: A key finding that Heliobacteria are phylogenetically closest to this evolutionary point for oxygenic photosynthetic organisms.

nodes.label: Earliest Phototrophic Lineage
nodes.description: A key finding that Purple Bacteria represent the earliest emerging group capable of photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Granick Hypothesis
nodes.description: A challenged hypothesis proposing that chlorophyll biosynthesis evolved before bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis.

nodes.label: Bacteriochlorophyll Predates Chlorophyll
nodes.description: A central finding of this study, indicating that bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis evolved before chlorophyll biosynthesis.

nodes.label: Previous 16S/Hsp Hypotheses
nodes.description: Earlier hypotheses, based on 16S rRNA or Hsp60/Hsp70 analyses, suggesting green nonsulfur bacteria or heliobacteria as the earliest phototrophs.
